text: Hey, this is somewhat of a vague question as I am largely unfamiliar with the Julia Geo community but what is the Julia geo package ecosystem like compared to Python - particularly to geopandas and folium? I desire to work with Julia for my data analysis but am curious if I will need to supplement my work with python packages via PyCall. Thanks all! _P.S. I am not asking exactly about community/adoption sort of stuff - Python has been around much longer than Julia so I don't expect Geo Julia to have as much. However, if it has the essentials, then heck yea! I can do my analysis in Julia!_ :juliaheartpulse-dark:

elements.text: Hey, this is somewhat of a vague question as I am largely unfamiliar with the Julia Geo community but what is the Julia geo package ecosystem like compared to Python - particularly to geopandas and folium? P.S. I am not asking exactly about community/adoption sort of stuff - Python has been around much longer than Julia so I don't expect Geo Julia to have as much. However, if it has the essentials, then heck yea! I can do my analysis in Julia!

text: IMO the geo stack is decently mature be it parsing, plotting or manipulating. It'd be nice if  you can further elaborate on what all you might need?

elements.text: IMO the geo stack is decently mature be it parsing, plotting or manipulating. It'd be nice if  you can further elaborate on what all you might need?

text: Sure! Again, somewhat vague as I am not sure everything that I need at the moment but the ability to do such work as census tract mapping, choropleth maps, and relating metadata to specific regions of a map for filtering/accessing.

elements.text: Sure! Again, somewhat vague as I am not sure everything that I need at the moment but the ability to do such work as census tract mapping, choropleth maps, and relating metadata to specific regions of a map for filtering/accessing.

text:
For something like geopandas, see Maarten's message in <#C9XBLUCVB|geo> from Friday, where he announced <https://github.com/evetion/GeoDataFrames.jl>.
Folium is a wrapper around LeafletJS. There is LeafletJS.jl but it would need to be resurrected after 4 years. If you search Discourse for "choropleth" there are some suggestions, using Plots, GeoMakie, or VegaLite for instance.
